head.title: Porcini and Herbal Bouillon Cubes Act More Like Flavor Bombshells

hedline.hl1: Porcini and Herbal Bouillon Cubes Act More Like Flavor Bombshells

abstract.p: Bouillon cubes now come in flavors like porcini and garlic; photo (S)

block.p: Drop a little cube into boiling water and get, not everyday chicken or beef bouillon, but a porcini mushroom broth for making a risotto, mushroom soup or a stew. Plop another tiny cube, a creamy frozen square of minced garlic, into a pasta sauce, and watch it dissolve, releasing a sharp jolt of flavor.

The porcini cubes, from Italy, are sold in boxes of 10 for $1.98 at Fairway, 2127 Broadway (74th Street) and 2328 12th Avenue (132nd Street), and at Zabar's, 80th Street and Broadway. The garlic cubes, from Israel, come frozen; each is the equivalent of one clove and is made only of garlic, vegetable oil and salt. They are sold in packages of 20 for $2.99 at Balducci's, 424 Avenue of the Americas (Ninth Street) and 133A West 66th Street.

Fairway also carries cubes made of herbs like oregano, rosemary, basil or parsley, which can add flavor to broths and sauces; they are $1.98 for eight. And Zabar's has a tomato and onion bouillon cube. I would take these cook's helpers along on summer camping trips. One caveat: they are salty, so don't do any seasoning until they've been added.
